attributes.action: Name younger adults if they are charged for murder/manslaughter with any weapon.
attributes.additional_details: I think the current restriction needs to be challenged and reviewed, crying a weapon MUST have consequences, and this would be a good start!
attributes.background: The current restriction on releasing the names of persons being prosecuted for murder or manslaughter, because of their age is too restrictive. If say 12 - 16 years old, are “old enough” to carry weapons of any sort; knives, machetes, guns etc, then surely they are old enough to be named?

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action:

Name people under 18 who are found guilty of murder 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/714967
